sen.j: 阿部 正右（あべ まさすけ、享保9年11月29日 (旧暦)（1725年1月13日） - 明和6年7月12日 (旧暦)（1769年8月13日））は、江戸時代の大名、老中。
sen.e: Masasuke ABE (January 13, 1725 – August 13, 1769) is daimyo (a feudal lord) and roju (a member of shogun's council of elders) of the Edo period.
Masasuke ABE (January 13, 1725 – August 13, 1769) was a daimyo (a feudal lord) and a roju (a member of the shogun's council of elders) during the Edo period.
Masasuke ABE (January 13, 1725 – August 13, 1769) was a daimyo (a feudal lord) and a roju (a member of the shogun's council of elders) during the Edo period.

sen.j: 備後福山藩3代藩主。
sen.e: The third lord of Bingofukuyama Domain.
He was the third lord of the Bingofukuyama Domain.
He was the third lord of the Bingofukuyama Domain.

sen.j: 阿部家宗家7代。
sen.e: The seventh head family of the Abe family.
He was the seventh head of the Abe family.
He was the seventh head of the Abe family.

sen.j: 2代藩主阿部正福の次男。
sen.e: The second son of Masatomi ABE, the second lord of the domain.
He was the second son of Masatomi ABE, the second lord of the domain.
He was the second son of Masatomi ABE, the second lord of the domain.

sen.j: 母は島津吉貴の養女（鳥居忠英の娘）。
sen.e: Mother - Yoshitaka SHIMAZU's adopted daughter (Tadateru TORII's daughter)
Mother - Yoshitaka SHIMAZU's adopted daughter (Tadateru TORII's daughter).
Mother - Yoshitaka SHIMAZU's adopted daughter (Tadateru TORII's daughter).

sen.j: 正室は丹羽高寛の娘。
sen.e: Lawful wife - Takahiro NIWA's daughter
Lawful wife - Takahiro NIWA's daughter.
Lawful wife - Takahiro NIWA's daughter.

sen.j: 子は阿部正表（長男）、阿部正固（次男）、阿部正倫（三男）。
sen.e: Children - 正表 ABE (oldest son), Msakata ABE (second son), Masatomo ABE (third son).
Children - 正表 ABE (oldest son), Masakata ABE (second son), Masatomo ABE (third son).
Children - 正表 ABE (oldest son), Masakata ABE (second son), Masatomo ABE (third son).

sen.j: 幼名、富之助。
sen.e: Childhood name - Tominosuke
Childhood name - Tominosuke.
Childhood name - Tominosuke.

sen.j: 初名、正治。
sen.e: Original name -正治
Original name - 正治.
Original name - 正治.

sen.j: 享保9年（1724年）、備後福山藩主・阿部正福の次男として江戸藩邸で生れる。
sen.e: In 1724 born as the second son of Masatomi ABE, the lord of Bingofukuyama Domain, in Edohantei (residence maintained by a daimyo in Edo).
He was born in 1724 as the second son of Masatomi ABE, the lord of the Bingofukuyama Domain, in Edohantei (residence maintained by a daimyo in Edo).
sen.cmt: This information contradicts the previous date of birth given above (1725).
sen.e: He was born in 1724 as the second son of Masatomi ABE, the lord of the Bingofukuyama Domain, in Edohantei (residence maintained by a daimyo in Edo).

sen.j: 元文3年（1738年）に14歳で徳川吉宗に拝謁し、伊予守に任じられ従五位下に叙される。
sen.e: In 1738 at the age of 14, had an audience with Yoshimune TOKUGAWA (the eighth Shogun), assigned to Iyo no Kami (Governor of Iyo Province) and raised to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
sen.cmt: 「徳川吉宗」の説明として「8代将軍」を加えました。
sen.e: In 1738, at the age of 14, he had an audience with Yoshimune TOKUGAWA (the eighth Shogun), was assigned as Iyo no Kami (Governor of Iyo Province) and promoted to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).

In 1738, at the age of 14, he had an audience with Yoshimune TOKUGAWA (the eighth Shogun), was assigned as Iyo no Kami (Governor of Iyo Province) and promoted to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).

sen.j: 寛延元年（1748年）25歳で正福から家督を譲られ、明和6年（1769年）に死去するまで28年間藩主を務めた。
sen.e: In 1748 at the age of 25, succeeded to the family estate from Masatomi and perfomed his duty as the lord for 28 years until died in 1769.
In 1748 at the age of 25, he succeeded the position of head of the family estate from Masatomi and performed his duty as the lord for 28 years until he died in 1769.
In 1748 at the age of 25, he succeeded the position of head of the family estate from Masatomi and performed his duty as the lord for 28 years until he died in 1769.

sen.j: ただし、藩主在任期間の大部分は幕政へ参画しており、藩政に直接関与することは殆どなかった。
sen.e: However, for the most part of the term of office, engaged in the shogunate government, not directly in administration of the domain.
However, for the majority of his term of office, he was engaged in the shogunate government, not directly in administration of the domain.
However, for the majority of his term of office, he was engaged in the shogunate government, not directly in administration of the domain.

sen.j: 福山藩主に就任した正右は寛延3年（1730年）に福山に入国し領内を視察するが、その後は江戸または京都に住まった。
sen.e: Masasuke, assuming the lord of Fukuyama Domain, entered Fukuyama in 1730 and inspected his domain, but after that he stayed in Edo or Kyoto.
Masasuke, assuming the position of lord of the Fukuyama Domain, entered Fukuyama in 1730 and inspected his domain, but after that he stayed in Edo or Kyoto.
Masasuke, assuming the position of lord of the Fukuyama Domain, entered Fukuyama in 1730 and inspected his domain, but after that he stayed in Edo or Kyoto.

sen.j: 宝暦2年（1752年）に奏者番に任じられ、同6年（1756年）に寺社奉行を兼任し、同10年（1760年）には京都所司代に転任し従四位下に叙された。
sen.e: In 1752 appointed to Sojaban (an official in charge of the ceremonies), in 1756 to Jisha Bugyo (the magistrate in charge of temples and shrines) as his additional post, and in 1760 transferred to Kyoto Shoshidai (the head of the governmental office in Kyoto) and raised to Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).
sen.cmt: 「寺社奉行」はjishabugyo (magistrate of temples and shrines)になっていますが、役職ですのでJisha Bugyoとし、括弧の説明を少し変えました。また「京都所司代」の説明を加えました。
sen.e: In 1752 he was appointed as Sojaban (an official in charge of ceremonies), in 1756 he was assigned as Jisha Bugyo (the magistrate in charge of temples and shrines) as his additional post, and in 1760 he transferred to the post of Kyoto Shoshidai (the head of the governmental office in Kyoto) and was promoted to Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).

In 1752 he was appointed as Sojaban (an official in charge of ceremonies), in 1756 he was assigned as Jisha Bugyo (the magistrate in charge of temples and shrines) as his additional post, and in 1760 he transferred to the post of Kyoto Shoshidai (the head of the governmental office in Kyoto) and was promoted to Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).

sen.j: 京都所司代在任中には先例を破り処分を受けることもあったが、後桜町天皇即位の祭礼を取りまとめるなど活躍する。
sen.e: While in office of Kyoto Shoshidai, sometimes punished due to breaking with precedent, but actively involved in arranging the rites and festivals for enthronement of Empress Gosakuramachi, and so on.
sen.cmt: 「後桜町天皇」は女性ですので、Empress Gosakuramachiとしました。http://dic.yahoo.co.jp/dsearch?enc=UTF-8&stype=1&dtype=0&p=後桜町天皇
sen.e: While holding the office of Kyoto Shoshidai, he was sometimes punished due to breaking with precedent, but was actively involved in arranging the rites and festivals for enthronement of Empress Gosakuramachi, and so on.

While holding the office of Kyoto Shoshidai, he was sometimes punished due to breaking with precedent, but was actively involved in arranging the rites and festivals for enthronement of the Empress Gosakuramachi, and so on.

sen.j: 明和元年（1764年）に西丸老中に就任し、翌年（1765年）本丸老中に任じられる。
sen.e: In 1764 assumed Nishinomaru Roju, and the next year (1765) appointed to Honmaru Roju.
In 1764, he assumed the position of Nishinomaru Roju, and the next year (1765) was appointed as Honmaru Roju.
In 1764, he assumed the position of Nishinomaru Roju, and in the next year (1765), he was appointed as Honmaru Roju.
sen.cmt: 一部、翻訳を変更しました。

sen.j: 尚、阿部家宗家が老中を務めるのは阿部重次以来約100年ぶりであった。
sen.e: By the way, it was the first time in about 100 years since Shigetsugu ABE that the head family of the Abe family took the position of Roju.
Furthermore, it was the first time in about 100 years, since Shigetsugu ABE, that the head of the Abe family took the position of Roju.
Furthermore, it was the first time in about 100 years, since Shigetsugu ABE, that the head of the Abe family took the position of Roju.

sen.j: しかし、一方で正右の出世には多額の経費が費やされ、福山藩は無理な支出を強いられることになった。
sen.e: On one hand, however, Masasuke's successful career took a great cost and forced Fukuyama Domain to spend excessive expense.
On one hand, however, Masasuke's successful career cost a great deal and forced the Fukuyama Domain to spend in excess.
On one hand, however, Masasuke's successful career cost a great deal and forced the Fukuyama Domain to spend in excess.

sen.j: このため藩は藩札（銀札）を濫発し厳しい財政を補填しようとしたが、勢い市場を混乱に陥れ藩の信用は失墜することになった。
sen.e: Therefore, the domain overissued han bills (bills usable only in a particular feudal clan) (ginsatsu [bills used for silver]) to compensate for the difficult financial situation, but inevitably confused the market, causing the domain to lose its credibility.

Therefore, the domain over issued han bills (bills usable only in a particular feudal clan) (ginsatsu [bills used for silver]) to compensate for the difficult financial situation, but inevitably confused the market, causing the domain to lose its credibility.

Therefore, the domain overissued han bills (bills usable only in a particular feudal clan) (ginsatsu [bills used for silver]) to compensate for the difficult financial situation, but inevitably confused the market, causing the domain to lose its credibility.
sen.cmt: over issuedをoverissuedに変更しました。

sen.j: 事態に窮した藩は藩札の強制使用を命じ、更には「御用銀」を領民に賦課した。
sen.e: The domain, puzzled at the situation, not only ordered compulsory use of the han bills but also imposed 'goyogin' (forced loans) on the people of the domain.
The domain, puzzled by this situation, not only ordered compulsory use of the han bills, but also imposed 'goyogin' (forced loans) on the people of the domain.
The domain, puzzled by this situation, not only ordered compulsory use of the han bills, but also imposed 'goyogin' (forced loans) on the people of the domain.

sen.j: だが、宝暦3年（1753年）これに反発した領民による一揆が勃発して政策は撤回されることになった。
sen.e: But in 1753 an uprising broke out by people who opposed this and the policy was decided to be withdrawn.
However, in 1753 an uprising broke out led by people who opposed this and it was decided to withdraw the policy.
However, in 1753 an uprising broke out led by people who opposed this and it was decided to withdraw the policy.

sen.j: その後、藩は流通統制や財政の緊縮に努め財政の健全化を計ろうとするが正右は死去までに状況が好転することはなかった。
sen.e: Thereafter, the domain strived for control of circulation and financial retrenchment, trying to put the finances on a sound footing, but the situation never changed for the better before Masasuke died.

Thereafter, the domain strove for control of circulation of finances and the economy, trying to put the finances on a firm foundation, but the situation never changed for the better before Masasuke died.

Thereafter, the domain strove for control of circulation of finances and the economy, trying to put the finances on a firm foundation, but the situation never changed for the better before Masasuke died.

sen.j: また、こうした状況の中で藩士の綱紀は弛緩しきったという。
sen.e: Besides, they say that under these circumstances, official discipline of retainers of the domain became overrelaxed.
Also, it is said that under these circumstances, official discipline of retainers of the domain became overly relaxed.
Also, it is said that under these circumstances, official discipline of retainers of the domain became overly relaxed.

sen.j: 後を三男・正倫が継いだ。
sen.e: The third son Masatomo succeeded him.
His third son, Masatomo, succeeded him.
His third son, Masatomo, succeeded him.

sen.j: 1724年（享保9年） 生誕（11月29日 (旧暦)）
sen.e: 1725: He was born in January 13.
1725: He was born on January 13th.
1725: He was born on January 13th.

sen.j: 1738年（元文3年） 従五位下・伊予守
sen.e: 1738: He was appointed as Jugoinoge, Iyo no Kami.
1738: He was appointed as Jugoinoge, Iyo no Kami.
1738: He was appointed as Jugoinoge, Iyo no Kami.

sen.j: 1748年（寛延元年） 相続（11月19日 (旧暦)）
sen.e: 1749: He inherited family estate on January 7.
1749: He inherited the family estate on January 7th.
1749: He inherited the family estate on January 7th.

sen.j: 1752年（宝暦2年） 奏者番に就任
sen.e: 1752: He assumed a position of Sojaban.
1752: He assumed the position of Sojaban.
1752: He assumed the position of Sojaban.

sen.j: 1756年（宝暦6年） 寺社奉行を兼務（5月7日 (旧暦)）
sen.e: 1756: He served as an additional post of Jisha Bugyo (June 4)
1756: He held an additional post as Jisha Bugyo (June 4th).
1756: He held an additional post as Jisha Bugyo (June 4th).

sen.j: 1760年（宝暦10年） 奏者番兼寺社奉行から京都所司代に転任（12月3日 (旧暦)）
sen.e: 1761: He was transferred to Kyoto Shoshidai from Sojaban-cum-Jisha Bugyo (January 8)
1761: He was transferred to the position of Kyoto Shoshidai from Sojaban-cum-Jisha Bugyo (January 8th).
1761: He was transferred to the position of Kyoto Shoshidai from Sojaban-cum-Jisha Bugyo (January 8th).

sen.j: 1764年（明和元年） 京都所司代から西丸老中に転任
sen.e: 1764: He was transferred to Nishinomaru Roju from Kyoto Shoshidai
1764: He was transferred to the position of Nishinomaru Roju from Kyoto Shoshidai.
1764: He was transferred to the position of Nishinomaru Roju from Kyoto Shoshidai.

sen.j: 1765年（明和2年） 西丸から本丸老中に転属（12月22日 (旧暦)）
sen.e: 1766: He was transferred to Honmaru Roju from Nishinomaru (February 1).
1766: He was transferred to the position of Honmaru Roju from Nishinomaru (February 1st).
1766: He was transferred to the position of Honmaru Roju from Nishinomaru (February 1st).

sen.j: 1769年（明和6年） 老中・藩主在職のまま死去（7月12日 (旧暦)）、享年46
sen.e: 1769: He died in office of Roju and the lord (August 13), at the age of 46.
1769: He died while still holding office as a Roju and a lord (August 13th), at the age of 46.
1769: He died while still holding office as a Roju and a lord (August 13th), at the age of 46.

sen.j: 諡：西閣院殿楼誉託方練契
sen.e: Shi (a posthumous name) - 西閣院殿楼誉託方練契
sen.cmt: 意味解釈が困難なため訳出できず
sen.e: Shi (a posthumous name) - 西閣院殿楼誉託方練契
Shi (a posthumous name) - 西閣院殿楼誉託方練契

sen.j: 墓地：西福寺（台東区浅草）、のち谷中墓地（台東区谷中 (台東区)）に改葬
sen.e: Cemetery - Saifuku-ji Temple, later reburied at Yanaka Cemetery (Yanaka of Taito Ward [Taito Ward]).
Cemetery - Saifuku-ji Temple, later reburied at Yanaka Cemetery (Yanaka of Taito Ward [Taito Ward]).
Cemetery - Saifuku-ji Temple, later reburied at Yanaka Cemetery (Yanaka of Taito Ward [Taito Ward]).

sen.j: 1738年（元文3年） 従五位下・伊予守
sen.e: 1738: He became Jugoinoge, Iyo no Kami
1738: He became Jugoinoge, Iyo no Kami.
1738: He became Jugoinoge, Iyo no Kami.

sen.j: 1760年（宝暦10年） 従四位下、侍従
sen.e: 1760: He became Jushiinoge, jiju (a chamberlain)
1760: He became Jushiinoge, jiju (a chamberlain).
1760: He became Jushiinoge, jiju (a chamberlain).
